dict.acceptation: 有礼貌的；有教养的，文雅的；上流社会的；应酬的，客套的；

sent.orig: If you really must choose between being sincere and being polite, be polite.
sent.trans: 如果你非得要从表现出真诚和礼貌之间作出选择，那么就选择礼貌吧。

sent.orig: He was extremely polite to Lavinia, scrupulously, formally polite.
sent.trans: 他对拉维尼娅彬彬有礼，简直到了谨慎小心、一本正经的地步。

sent.orig: You're always polite and Mr. Davis is always polite.
sent.trans: 您从来都是好说好商量的，戴维先生也从来都是好说好商量的。

sent.orig: At Silver's polite salute he somewhat flushed.
sent.trans: 看到希尔弗在必恭必敬地向他行礼，他一下子气得满脸通红。

sent.orig: They were slumming all right but they were polite and they seemed nice people.
sent.trans: 他们好象是来视察贫民窟的，有教养，不失风度。
